intro: Thesium selagineum, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, pale pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and rocky soils, often in coastal or inland regions. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are densely packed. Thesium selagineum is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its unique, delicate appearance.
